name: Harpoon Hanna’s
shortBlurb: Iconic Fenwick waterfront spot for seafood, raw bar favorites, and bayside views.
longBlurb: Harpoon Hanna’s is a must-stop for visitors—fresh seafood, a raw bar, and that classic Fenwick bayside atmosphere that feels like vacation.

name: Mio Fratello Italian Steakhouse
shortBlurb: A sit-down Italian option that works when not everyone wants just pizza.
longBlurb: Mio Fratello is a good group-friendly pick because the menu covers pizza, pasta, and steaks without feeling fussy. It’s an easy choice for families or mixed cravings when you want one place that can satisfy everyone.

name: Jimmy’s Kitchen
shortBlurb: No-frills breakfast with generous portions—popular with locals for a reason.
longBlurb: Jimmy’s Kitchen is straightforward, fast, and filling. It’s a great stop before the beach when you want classic breakfast comfort without a long wait or a complicated menu.

name: Grotto Pizza
shortBlurb: A Bethany classic known for swirl-style pizza and boardwalk convenience.
longBlurb: Grotto Pizza hits the beach-town nostalgia sweet spot. The signature swirl-style pies make it feel like a “you have to do it once” place, and it’s an easy choice if you’re staying near the boardwalk.

name: Bluecoast Seafood Grill
shortBlurb: Polished but approachable seafood grill with creative plates and a strong cocktail program.
longBlurb: Bluecoast is a great Bethany dinner choice when you want fresh fish and creative plates without it feeling too formal.

name: Bethany Blues BBQ
shortBlurb: Smoked meats, big portions, and a lively atmosphere—great for a hearty night out.
longBlurb: Bethany Blues is the type of place you go when you want something filling and unfussy. It’s group-friendly, energetic, and a reliable pick when you’re in the mood for BBQ and a casual night.

name: Dough Roller
shortBlurb: An OC staple for thick-crust pizza and efficient service—ideal after the beach.
longBlurb: Dough Roller is popular for a reason: it’s fast, reliable, and built for groups. If you want a satisfying, no-drama dinner in Ocean City, this is an easy default.

name: Fish Tales
shortBlurb: Bayside, lively, and built for summer—go for the docks and the atmosphere.
longBlurb: Fish Tales is a vacation-energy waterfront spot with outdoor seating and docks right there. The menu leans casual seafood, but the setting is the main reason people keep coming back.

name: The Hobbit Restaurant
shortBlurb: One of OC’s more refined dining options—quiet, intimate, and special-occasion worthy.
longBlurb: The Hobbit is best saved for nights when you want a slower pace and a more elevated experience. It’s not a quick beach meal—this is a sit-down, make-an-evening-of-it spot.

name: Dumser’s Dairyland
shortBlurb: Legendary OC ice cream stand for thick milkshakes, hand-dipped cones, and huge portions.
longBlurb: Worth the short drive when you want a classic Ocean City dessert stop—big portions, thick shakes, and nostalgic summer vibes.

name: Annabelle’s BBQ & Burgers
shortBlurb: A laid-back Fenwick spot serving juicy burgers alongside BBQ favorites.
longBlurb: Annabelle’s is a reliable casual stop for burgers and BBQ classics. Great for takeout, easy dinners, and satisfying comfort food close to the beach.

name: Backyard BBQ & Grill
address: 126th St & Coastal Hwy, Ocean City, MD
shortBlurb: A North OC go-to for serious BBQ cravings—ribs, pulled pork, brisket, and big, hearty platters.
longBlurb: Backyard BBQ is a crowd-pleaser when you want classic smoked meats and you’re hungry-hungry. It’s a solid pick for groups, and the menu hits the usual BBQ heavyweights—ribs, pork, brisket—served in the kind of portions you plan your day around.

name: Blue Water Grill
shortBlurb: Not strictly BBQ, but a good mixed-menu waterfront option with BBQ-leaning dishes alongside seafood and classics.
longBlurb: Blue Water Grill is a practical move when your group can’t agree—someone wants seafood, someone wants comfort food, and you want a view. It’s not a pure BBQ joint, but it’s a useful “everyone wins” option with BBQ-inspired choices in the mix.

name: Bad Monkey
shortBlurb: A lively bayside hangout for burgers, drinks, and waterfront vibes.
longBlurb: Bad Monkey is a go-to when you want a fun atmosphere, solid burgers, and drinks by the water. Great for groups and the kind of place where a quick bite can turn into a longer hang.

name: The Bayside Skillet
shortBlurb: A legendary Fenwick Island breakfast and brunch institution.
longBlurb: The Bayside Skillet is a must-do morning stop, famous for omelets, crepes, and fresh-squeezed juices. It’s popular for a reason—arrive early or be ready to wait.

name: Barn 34
shortBlurb: A modern Bethany brunch favorite with creative takes on breakfast classics.
longBlurb: Barn 34 offers a polished but relaxed brunch experience with quality coffee, cocktails, and inventive dishes. A great choice for brunch with friends.

name: The Breakfast House
shortBlurb: A Bethany Beach staple for classic breakfast plates and friendly service.
longBlurb: The Breakfast House is known for consistency, generous portions, and a welcoming vibe. Popular with both locals and visitors, especially in the mornings.

name: Sunny Bay Café
shortBlurb: A bright, beachy café serving creative brunch dishes and smoothies.
longBlurb: Sunny Bay Café is a great option when you want something lighter—smoothies, coffee drinks, and creative breakfast plates in a relaxed setting.

name: Bayard’s Donut Shop
shortBlurb: An iconic Bethany donut shop with fresh donuts and pastries.
longBlurb: Bayard’s is a Bethany Beach classic. Fresh donuts, simple breakfast items, and lines that form early for a reason.

name: Fractured Prune
shortBlurb: Made-to-order donuts served hot with endless glaze and topping combos—beach-trip must.
longBlurb: Great for sweet breakfasts or late-night treats—fresh, hot donuts customized exactly how you want.

name: Ocean View Coffee Company
shortBlurb: A cozy local coffee shop with breakfast sandwiches and pastries.
longBlurb: Ocean View Coffee Company is a reliable stop for good coffee, breakfast sandwiches, and a relaxed local feel before heading to the beach.

name: The Greene Turtle
shortBlurb: A reliable sports bar with a strong burger lineup, big portions, and lots of TVs.
longBlurb: The Greene Turtle is a dependable move for burgers, beers, and groups—especially if you want to catch a game. Expect a classic sports-bar vibe, plenty of seating, and a menu that works for mixed groups.

name: Ropewalk
shortBlurb: Lively bayside seafood spot for steamed crabs, platters, and dockside drinks—great for groups.
longBlurb: Ropewalk is a family-and-friends favorite: casual, lively, and built for big tables, steamed crabs, and bayside hangouts.

name: Crabcake Factory
address: North Ocean City, MD (137th St & Coastal Hwy)
shortBlurb: Big portions, loud beach-town energy, and oversized burgers alongside seafood favorites.
longBlurb: Crabcake Factory is known for massive portions and a casual, lively vibe. A good pick when you want a burger that’s over-the-top (and you don’t mind a busy scene).

name: Five Guys
shortBlurb: Made-to-order burgers with endless toppings and fresh fries—dependable and quick.
longBlurb: Five Guys is a classic fast-casual burger stop when you want something consistent: burgers done your way, plus fries that travel well back to the beach house.

name: Smashburger
shortBlurb: Smash-style burgers with crispy edges, plus shakes and sides.
longBlurb: Smashburger is a solid alternative when you want something better than standard fast food—smash-style patties, good sides, and shakes if you’re leaning indulgent.

name: Fenwick Pub
shortBlurb: A true local pub for solid burgers, pub classics, and a relaxed neighborhood feel.
longBlurb: Fenwick Pub is a great pick when you want a simple burger and a beer without the touristy feel. It’s laid-back, reliable, and feels like a local staple.

name: Papa Grande Mexican Grill
shortBlurb: Fast-casual Mexican spot with generous portions, bold flavors, and quick service.
longBlurb: A solid choice for burritos, tacos, and bowls when you want something filling without a long sit-down meal.

name: Chipotle Mexican Grill
shortBlurb: Fast, consistent burritos and bowls—reliable and customizable.
longBlurb: Perfect for quick lunches or takeout when you want something consistent and easy to customize.

name: Grab & Go Taco
shortBlurb: Quick, flavorful tacos and burritos—ideal for beach days and fast meals.
longBlurb: A small, casual taco spot focused on fast service and easy takeout when you don’t want a long wait.

name: Taco Bar
shortBlurb: Modern taco spot with creative combos and casual vibes.
longBlurb: Great for a quick bite after the beach when you want something more creative than standard tacos.

name: Pancho & Lefty’s
shortBlurb: Tex-Mex tacos and bowls with a laid-back coastal feel.
longBlurb: A solid Bethany option for casual Mexican/Tex-Mex that’s easy, approachable, and good for takeout or a relaxed meal.

name: Plaza Tapatia
shortBlurb: Authentic Mexican with generous portions and a strong local following.
longBlurb: Worth the short inland drive for traditional flavors and a relaxed sit-down vibe.

name: La Sierra Mexican Restaurant
shortBlurb: Classic Mexican comfort food in a relaxed sit-down atmosphere.
longBlurb: Popular for familiar favorites like fajitas and enchiladas—easy dinner option with a casual vibe.

name: Señor Frog’s
shortBlurb: More party than traditional—Tex-Mex, margaritas, and high-energy dining.
longBlurb: A tourist favorite when you want a loud, fun atmosphere with margaritas and familiar Tex-Mex-style food.

name: Ocean Side
address: 205 Coastal Hwy Unit 2, Fenwick Island, DE
shortBlurb: Fenwick staple since the 1980s for classic pizza, subs, and easy beach-town takeout.
longBlurb: Ocean Side is reliable, unfussy, and perfect for casual beach dinners or grabbing takeout when you want classic pizza and subs without overthinking it.

name: Surf’s Edge Deli & Pizzeria
shortBlurb: Great for slices, full pies, and deli favorites—easy lunch or no-frills dinner in Fenwick.
longBlurb: Surf’s Edge is ideal when you want a quick slice, a full pie for the house, or deli staples for beach picnics—simple, fast, and convenient.

name: Mancini’s Brick Oven Pizzeria
shortBlurb: Brick-oven pizza plus Italian classics—good when the group wants pizza *and* pasta.
longBlurb: Mancini’s is a strong option when you want brick-oven pizza, but also need pasta and Italian entrees for mixed cravings at the table.

name: House of Sauce
address: 300 Coastal Hwy Unit 21, Fenwick Island, DE
shortBlurb: Local favorite for pizza, wings, and bar-style comfort food near the beach.
longBlurb: House of Sauce is a relaxed dinner spot for pizza and comfort food—popular for casual nights out and easy beach-town meals.

name: Ponzetti’s Pizza
address: 144th St Coastal Hwy, Ocean City, MD
shortBlurb: Beach-town pizza + sports bar vibes—big pies, late hours, lively atmosphere.
longBlurb: Ponzetti’s is a classic move for a lively sit-down pizza night or late-hour cravings—especially with a group.

name: 4 Brothers Pizza & Grill
shortBlurb: Bethany favorite with a big menu—great for families with mixed cravings.
longBlurb: 4 Brothers is a reliable Bethany choice when you need pizza plus options for everyone—easy for takeout, delivery, or a casual sit-down.

name: Delizia’s Pizza
shortBlurb: Well-reviewed for quality ingredients and consistently good pies.
longBlurb: Delizia’s is a strong option for both takeout and casual dine-in when you want a reliably good pie with quality ingredients.

name: Luca’s Pizza
address: 37031 Old Mill Bridge Rd, Selbyville, DE
shortBlurb: Longtime inland favorite for thin-crust pizza and classic subs—worth the short drive.
longBlurb: Luca’s is a dependable inland option when you want thin-crust pizza and subs and don’t mind a short drive from the beach towns.

name: Our Harvest
shortBlurb: Modern seafood + farm-to-table with fresh, local ingredients in a relaxed coastal setting.
longBlurb: A higher-quality seafood option that leans fresh and local—great when you want something a bit more modern but still easygoing.

name: One Coastal
shortBlurb: Upscale coastal dining with refined seafood and craft cocktails—ideal for special dinners.
longBlurb: One Coastal is the move for a date night or celebration: elevated seafood-forward dishes, an intimate vibe, and strong cocktails.

name: Off the Hook
shortBlurb: One of Bethany’s top-rated seafood spots—elevated dishes with seasonal menus and thoughtful presentation.
longBlurb: Off the Hook is a consistent standout for elevated seafood in Bethany—great for date nights or when you want a nicer meal.

name: Crab Bag
address: 138th St Coastal Hwy, Ocean City, MD
shortBlurb: North OC institution for steamed crabs, crab cakes, and classic Maryland seafood.
longBlurb: A no-frills, very Maryland kind of seafood stop—popular in season for steamed crabs and classic favorites.

name: Higgins Crab House
address: 128th St Coastal Hwy, Ocean City, MD
shortBlurb: All-you-can-eat seafood and steamed crabs with classic Ocean City family vibes.
longBlurb: Built for big appetites and family dinners—go hungry if you’re doing AYCE.

name: Matt’s Fish Camp
shortBlurb: Popular coastal spot with a seafood twist, cocktails, and a lively brunch-and-dinner vibe.
longBlurb: A great pick when you want seafood-inspired dishes and cocktails in a fun, upbeat setting—especially on weekends.

name: Catch 54
shortBlurb: Refined waterfront seafood with excellent sunset views—ideal for special dinners.
longBlurb: Catch 54 overlooks Assawoman Bay and is known for seasonal seafood, creative presentations, and sunset views that make it a go-to for date nights.

name: Blue Fish
shortBlurb: Modern sushi + pan-Asian with creative rolls and a polished but approachable vibe.
longBlurb: A strong sushi-night option close to the beach—creative rolls, pan-Asian plates, and a comfortable sit-down atmosphere.

name: Japan 7
shortBlurb: Popular North OC spot for sushi and hibachi with generous portions and consistent quality.
longBlurb: A reliable choice for mixed sushi/hibachi cravings—works well for families and groups.

name: Hokkaido Sushi & Hibachi
shortBlurb: Go-to for sushi rolls, hibachi dinners, and bento boxes—reliable for families and takeout.
longBlurb: Great when your group is split between sushi and hibachi—easy, casual, and dependable.

name: China Chef
shortBlurb: Classic Chinese takeout with familiar favorites—fast, no-frills, dependable near Fenwick.
longBlurb: A go-to when you want quick Chinese takeout without thinking too hard—solid staples and easy pickup.

name: Suki Hana
shortBlurb: Bethany option for sushi, teriyaki, and Japanese comfort dishes—easy and casual.
longBlurb: A solid pick for casual Japanese and sushi close to the boardwalk—good for families and easy dinners.

name: Thai Ocha
shortBlurb: Well-reviewed Thai spot for curries, noodles, and stir-fries—worth the short drive inland.
longBlurb: A great inland option when you’re craving Thai—curries, noodles, and classic stir-fries done well.

name: Asian Bistro
shortBlurb: Mixed Asian menu with Chinese, Japanese, and sushi—good all-around pick for varied tastes.
longBlurb: A flexible choice when your group has mixed cravings—enough range to keep everyone happy.

name: OC Wasabi
shortBlurb: Popular North OC sushi spot for creative specialty rolls and consistent quality.
longBlurb: A strong choice when you want sushi without heading deep into Ocean City—relaxed vibe, good rolls, reliable quality.

name: Candy Kitchen
shortBlurb: Classic coastal dessert stop for homemade ice cream, milkshakes, and old-school soda fountain vibes.
longBlurb: A Fenwick tradition—perfect for families who want ice cream, shakes, sundaes, and that nostalgic dessert-shop feel.

name: Fisher’s Popcorn
shortBlurb: Fresh-popped caramel popcorn and savory flavors that scream beach vacation—easy grab-and-go.
longBlurb: Perfect as a quick dessert, a boardwalk snack, or something to bring back to the house—sweet and savory flavors for everyone.

name: TC Scoops
shortBlurb: Bethany favorite for ice cream and sundaes just steps from the boardwalk—great after dinner.
longBlurb: Easy Bethany dessert stop when you want ice cream near the boardwalk—perfect for a simple walk-up treat after dinner.
